meanings.definition: Encourage or assist someone to do something wrong or illegal.
meanings.sent1: She abetted her friend in stealing the cookies.
meanings.sent2: He was arrested for abetting the criminal in his escape.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous duo abetted each other in pranking their classmates.
meanings.sent4: His silence abetted the spread of false rumors like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The online platform abetted cyberbullying among teenagers.

meanings.definition: Assist or support someone in a wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The group of friends abetted each other in skipping school.
meanings.sent2: She was accused of abetting the fraud scheme.
meanings.sent3: The siblings abetted in sneaking out of the house past curfew.
meanings.sent4: His actions inadvertently abetted the company's unethical practices.
meanings.sent5: The fake ID abetted underage drinking at the party.
